summary: In Finland, the political landscape is shifting as the Finns Party proposes a new rule to prohibit nepotism among candidates, aiming to enhance transparency and public trust. Concurrently, Kela, the Finnish social insurance institution, has urged citizens to review the income ceiling on their 2025 tax cards, highlighting the importance of financial planning amid changing economic conditions. Additionally, the Finnish comedy scene gains international recognition with two entries vying for prestigious awards, reflecting a growing cultural prominence. These developments underscore a broader societal focus on integrity in governance, economic awareness, and the celebration of Finnish creativity on global platforms.
